ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How do you feel about stopping drinking this time. On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 representing no desire to quit and 10 representing the greatest desire to quit, please circle your rating.
Notes: 1 = No desire to quit; 10 = Extremely high desire

ElementDescription: How successful you expect to be quitting drinking at this time. Be realistic about this, based on your past experiences and your present strength of motivation. Please circle the rating for expectation of success in quitting.
How difficult do you think it will be for you to keep from drinking after having quit. Remember, you are rating how difficult you think it will be for you to remain abstinent after quitting.

How confident are you that you will be able to quit drinking. Be realistic about this, based on your past experiences and your present strength of motivation. Please circle the rating for your level of confidence
How motivated you are to quit drinking at this time. Please circle the rating for your level of motivation.

What is the GOAL you have chosen for yourself about drinking at this time. Please read the goals listed on this page and check the box next to the one goal that best represents your own goal at this time. Be sure to read each goal before you select one that best describes your goal. Pick only one of the following goals. Which best describes your current goal for your alcohol use?
Notes: 1 =  Controlled use of alcohol (i.e., cut down but not stop completely); 2 = Temporary abstinence from alcohol; 3 = Occasional use of alcohol when urges strongly felt; 4 =  Total abstinence, but realize a slip is possible; 5 = Total abstinence - never use alcohol again; 6 = No goal

ElementDescription: Session time
Visit name
Expected difficulty of remaining abstinent subscale-Craving, General Well-Being and Negative Affect items
Expected difficulty of remaining abstinent subscale-General Well-Being
Expected difficulty of remaining abstinent subscale-Negative Affect

Notes: 1 = Controlled use of alcohol (i.e., cut down but not stop completely); 2 = Temporary abstinence from alcohol; 3 = Occasional use of alcohol when urges strongly felt; 4 = Total abstinence, but realize a slip is possible; 5 = Total abstinence - never use alcohol again; 6 = No goal

ElementDescription: Which best describes your current goal for your e-cigarette/vaping use?

ElementDescription: Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project (used for source IDs that change depending on timepoint/visit/etc.)
What is your recovery goal?
What are the top three motivators for remaining abstinent?
What aspects in life that addiction has negatively impacted you?
What are some goals and aspirations, or hopes and dreams you have for the future?
Who is the person you are closest with?
What are three hobbies you most enjoy doing?
When you used your most common drug of choice, what was the term you used to describe the way you were when you were intoxicated?
Notes: Examples include high, drunk, loaded, lit, down, smashed, wasted, etc.

ElementDescription: Which word do you prefer to use when you describe how you are currently in recovery?
Notes: For example, sober, clean, clean and sober, or in recovery

ElementDescription: How CONFIDENT are you that you will be able to reach your goal (change marijuana use) at this time?

Notes: 1 = Cut down but not stop completely; 2 = Temporary abstinence; 3 = Occasional use when urges are strong; 4 = Total abstinence, but realize a slip is possible; 5 = Total abstinence - never use again; 6 = No goal; 7 = Not applicable because I don't use any of these other substances
